alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern St. Lawrence County through 300 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Degrasse, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gouverneur, Oswegatchie, Fowler, Degrasse, Cranberry Lake, Fine, Pitcairn, Stark, Edwards, Lower Oswegatchie, Talcville, South Edwards, Fullerville, Newton Falls, Balmat, Shurtleff, West Fowler, and South Russell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
